attributes.action: Act against MPs who declare support for proscribed terrorist groups
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We call upon the government to take action when leaders of political parties break the law by expressing support for terrorists group proscribed in the UK. 

“Once a group is proscribed under powers in the Terrorism Act 2000, it becomes an offence to be a member of, or provide or show support for it,” says J Fanshaw of the Home Office. 

We call upon the British government to take action against MPs who do the country a great disservice. 

Failing to take action simply shows supporters of terror that they can freely continue to support terror without facing the law. This is not what the UK wants nor needs.
